info.title: Box 2.0 API
info.description: The Box Content API gives you access to secure content management and content experience features for use in your own app. It strives to be RESTful and is organized around the main resources you’re familiar with from the Box web interface.

ItemReference.description: It references either a file or a folder

sequence_id.description:
A unique ID for use with the /events endpoint.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

etag.description:
A unique string identifying the version of this folder.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

FileReference.description: It references either a file or a folder

sha1.description: The sha1 hash of this file.

FileVersionReference.description: The version information of the file.

sha1.description: The sha1 hash of this file.

login.description: The email address this user uses to login.

PathCollection.description: The path of folders, starting at the root.

ItemCollection.description: A collection of mini file and folder objects contained in this folder.

FolderUploadEmail.description: The upload email address for this folder. Null if not set.

FolderPermissions.description: The permissions that the current user has on the folder

FilePermissions.description: The permissions that the current user has on the file

Folder.title: Folder Object
Folder.description: Folders contain information about the items contained inside of them, including files and other folders. There is also a set of metadata such as who owns the folder and when it was modified that is also returned. When accessing other resources that make reference to folders, a ‘mini folder’ object will be used. The 'mini folder' object will return type, id, sequence_id, etag, and name.

created_at.description:
The time the folder was created.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

size.description: The folder size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer, it can easily go into EE notation: see IEEE754 format.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this folder, starting at the root.

created_by.description: The user who created this folder.

modified_by.description: The user who last modified this folder.

trashed_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were put in the trash.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

purged_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents will be purged from the trash.
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

content_created_at.description: The time the folder or its contents were originally created (according to the uploader).May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

content_modified_at.description:
The time the folder or its contents were last modified (according to the uploader).
May be null for some folders such as root or trash.

owned_by.description: The user who owns this folder.

shared_link.description: The shared link for this folder. Null if not set.

parent.description: The folder that contains this one.May be null for folders such as root, trash and child folders whose parent is inaccessible.

item_status.description: Whether this item is deleted or not.

sync_state.description: Whether this folder will be synced by the Box sync clients or not. Can be synced, not_synced, or partially_synced.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this folder has any collaborators.

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

can_non_owners_invite.description: Whether non-owners can invite collaborators to this folder.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this folder is owned by a user outside of the enterprise

allowed_shared_link_access_levels.description: Access level settings for shared links set by administrator. Can be collaborators, open, or company.

allowed_invitee_roles.description: Folder collaboration collaboration settings allowed by the enterprise administrator.

Lock.description: The lock held on the file.

BoxFile.title: File Object
BoxFile.description: File information describe file objects in Box, with attributes like who created the file, when it was last modified, and other information. The actual content of the file itself is accessible through the /files/{id}/content endpoint.

size.description: Size of this file in bytes.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this file, starting at the root.

created_at.description: When this file was created on Box’s servers.

modified_at.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

content_created_at.description: When the content of this file was created (more info).

content_modified_at.description: When the content of this file was last modified (more info).

created_by.description: The user who first created file.

modified_by.description: The user who last updated this file.

owned_by.description: The user who owns this file.

item_status.description: Whether this item is deleted or not.

version_number.description: The version number of the file.

comment_count.description: The number of comments on a file.

tags.description: All tags applied to this file.

extension.description: Indicates the suffix, when available, on the file. By default, set to an empty string. The suffix usually indicates the encoding (file format) of the file contents or usage.

is_package.description: Whether the file is a package. Used for Mac Packages used by iWorks.

expiring_embed_link.description: An expiring URL for an embedded preview session in an iframe. This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will expire after 60 minutes.

Collaboration.description: Collaborations are used to set and apply access permissions for users and groups to files and folders, similar to access control lists.

created_by.description: The user who created this collaboration

created_at.description: The time this collaboration was created

modified_at.description: The time this collaboration was last modified

expires_at.description: The time this collaboration will expire

status.description: The status of this collab. Can be accepted, pending, or rejected

accessible_by.description: The user or group who the collaboration applies to

role.description: The level of access this user or group has. Can be editor, viewer, previewer, uploader, previewer uploader, viewer uploader, co-owner, or owner

acknowledged_at.description: When the status of this collab was changed

can_view_path.description: Whether view path collaboration feature is enabled or not. View path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire ancestral path to the associated folder. The user will not gain privileges in any ancestral folder

message.description: A message that will be included with this task assignment

completed_at.description: The date at which this task assignment was completed

assigned_at.description: The date at which this task assignment was assigned

reminded_at.description: The date at which this task assignment was reminded

assigned_by.description: The user who assigned this task assignment

Task.title: Task Object
Task.description: Tasks enabled file-centric workflows in Box. User can create tasks on files and assign them to collaborators on Box. You can read more about tasks in Box here.

due_at.description: The date at which this task is due

action.description: The action the task assignee will be prompted to do. Must be review

message.description: A message that will be included with this task

is_completed.description: Whether or not this task has been completed

created_by.description: The user who created this task

WebLink.title: Web Link Object
WebLink.description: Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application. Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects, so they will also support shared links, copy, permanent delete, and restore with the format /web_links/{WEB_LINK_ID} in place of /files/{FILE_ID}.

parent.description: The parent object the web link belongs to

url.description: The URL this web link points to.

description.description: The description accompanying the web link. This is visible within the Box web application.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this item, starting at the root.

created_at.description: When this file was created on Box’s servers.

modified_at.description: When this file was last updated on the Box servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

created_by.description: The user who first created file.

modified_by.description: The user who last updated this file.

owned_by.description: The user who owns this file.

shared_link.description: The shared link object for this file.

item_status.description: Whether this item is deleted or not.

type.description: The data type of the field's value.

key.description: A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must be unique within the template to which it belongs. The character limit is 256. All characters are allowed.

displayName.description: The display name of the field. The character limit is 4096. All characters are allowed.

description.description: A description of the field. The character limit is 4096. All characters are allowed.

MetadataTemplate.title: Metadata Template Object
MetadataTemplate.description: Metadata that belongs to a file or folder is grouped by templates. Templates allow the metadata service to provide a multitude of services, such as pre-defining sets of key:value pairs or schema enforcement on specific fields.

templateKey.description: A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being applied to. Defaults to a string derived from the displayName if no value is provided.

displayName.description: The display name of the template. The character limit is 4096.

hidden.description: Whether this template is hidden in the UI

fields.description: The ordered set of key:value pairs for the template.

Metadata.title: Metadata Object
Metadata.description:
Metadata can be used for many purposes. Enterprises may want to have a better way to organize their digital assets for their marketing teams or developers may want to provide advanced content functionality such as facilitating workflows or approvals. Metadata is also visible in the Box Web Application. To learn more, please visit the help documentation.
Templates
Metadata that belongs to a file/folder is grouped by templates. Templates allow the metadata service to provide a multitude of services, such as pre-defining sets of key:value pairs or schema enforcement on specific fields. For example, a marketingCollateral template may define where and when specific marketing content should be used. You can also see the representation of the template in the Box web application while navigating to a file preview. Currently, metadata associated with folders does not show in the web application.
Each file/folder can have multiple distinct template instances associated with it, such as a marketingCollateral and retentionPolicy template instances. Template instances are also grouped by scopes. Currently, the only scopes support are enterprise and global. Enterprise scopes are defined on a per enterprises basis, whereas global scopes are Box application-wide. Attribute order within template instances is not guaranteed.
Currently, there are four attributes supported by templates: string, enum, float, and  date (RFC 3339).

Global Properties Template
In addition to enterprise scoped templates, every file on Box has access to the global properties template. The Properties template is a bucket of free form key:value string pairs, with no additional schema associated with it. Properties are ideal for scenarios where applications want to write metadata to file objects in a flexible way, without pre-defined template structure.
Properties follow all the conventions of standard templates, except for being located at a different endpoint. All requests made to the properties template must be made to /files/{file_id}/metadata/global/properties.

WatermarkReference.description: Waternmark a semi-transparent overlay on an embedded file preview that displays a viewer's email address or user ID and the time of access over a file's content

Collection.title: Collection Object
Collection.description: Collections contain information about the items contained inside of them, including files and folders. The only collection available currently is a “Favorites” collection. The contents of the collection are discovered in a similar way in which the contents of a folder are discovered.

name.description: The name of this collection. The only collection currently available is named “Favorites”

collection_type.description: The type of the collection. This is used to determine the proper visual treatment for Box-internally created collections. Initially only “favorites” collection-type will be supported.

Comment.title: Comment Object
Comment.description: Comments are messages generated by Box users. Each message is tied to a specific file. You can create comments independently or create them as responses to other comments.

is_reply_comment.description: Whether or not this comment is a reply to another comment

message.description: The comment text that the user typed

tagged_message.description: The string representing the comment text with @mentions included. @mention format is @[id:username]. Field is not included by default.

created_by.description: A mini user object representing the author of the comment

created_at.description: The time this comment was created

modified_at.description: The time this comment was last modified

event_id.description: The id of the event, used for de-duplication purposes

created_by.description: The user that performed the action. Some events may be performed by users not logged into Box. In those instances, not all attributes of this object will be populated and the event will be attributed to a unknown user (user_id = 2).

session_id.description: The session of the user that performed the action. Not all events will populate this attribute.

source.description: The object that was modified. See Object definitions for appropriate object: file, folder, comment, etc. Not all events have a source object.

additional_details.description: This object provides additional information about the event if available. This can include how a user performed an event as well as additional information to correlate an event to external Keysafe logs. Not all events have an additional_details object.  This object is only available in the Enterprise Events.

Webhook.title: Webhook Object
Webhook.description: When you create or retrieve a webhook a JSON object representing the webhook is returned to you. This JSON object's fields contain the name and ID of the webhook, along with configuration details such as its target and its notification URL.

target.description: A target is a file or folder

created_at.description: An RFC-3339 timestamp identifying the time that the webhook was created.

address.description: The notification URL of the webhook. The notification URL is the URL used by Box to send a notification when the webhook is triggered.

triggers.description: An array of event names. The events that webhooks support are listed in the 'Event Triggers' (https://docs.box.com/reference#event-triggers) section.

Enterprise.description: Mini representation of this user’s enterprise, including the ID of its enterprise.

User.title: User Object
User.description: The users endpoint is used for managing a user and its content. For an individual user, this includes their own user information and content. For an enterprise admin, this includes both the individual user and any other users in the admin’s enterprise account.

created_at.description: The time this user was created.

modified_at.description: The time this user was last modified.

language.description: The language of this user. (ISO 639-1 Language Code)

timezone.description: The timezone of this user. (tz Database timezones)

space_amount.description: The user’s total available space amount in bytes.

space_used.description: The amount of space in use by the user.

max_upload_size.description: The maximum individual file size in bytes this user can have.

status.description: Can be active, inactive, cannot_delete_edit, or cannot_delete_edit_upload.

avatar_url.description: URL of this user’s avatar image.

role.description: This user’s enterprise role. Can be admin, coadmin, or user.

tracking_codes.description: An array of key/value pairs set by the user’s admin.

can_see_managed_users.description: Whether this user can see other enterprise users in her contact list.

is_sync_enabled.description: Whether or not this user can use Box Sync.

is_external_collab_restricted.description: Whether this user is allowed to collaborate with users outside her enterprise.

is_exempt_from_device_limits.description: Whether to exempt this user from Enterprise device limits.

is_exempt_from_login_verification.description: Whether or not this user must use two-factor authentication.

my_tags.description: Tags for all files and folders owned by this user.

hostname.description: The root (protocol, subdomain, domain) of any links that need to be generated for this user

GroupReference.description: Mini representation of the group, including id and name of group.

Group.title: Group Object
Group.description: Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of users in some operations, such as collaborations.

created_at.description: When this groups was created on Box’s servers

modified_at.description: When this group was last updated on the Box servers

provenance.description: Keeps track of which external source this group is coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups", "Facebook Groups").  This should be a human-readable identifier up to 255 characters long.  Setting this will also prevent Box users from editing this group directly through Box.  This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups. Needs to be accessed via the fields parameter.

external_sync_identifier.description: An arbitrary identifier that can be used by external group sync tools to link this Box Group to an external group.  Example values of this field could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google Group ID.  We recommend use of this field in order to avoid issues when group names are updated in either Box or external systems. Needs to be accessed via the fields parameter.

description.description: Human readable description of this Group.  This can be up to 255 characters long. Needs to be accessed via the fields parameter.

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite this group to collaborate on folders (Create Collaboration).
admins_only Master Admin, Coadmins, group's Group Admin.
admins_and_members Admins listed above and group members.
all_managed_users All managed users in the enterprise.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of this group (Get Memberships for Group).
admins_only Master Admin, Coadmins, group's Group Admin.
admins_and_members Admins and group members.
all_managed_users All managed users in the enterprise.

GroupMembership.title: Membership Object
GroupMembership.description: Membership is used to signify that a user is part of a group. Membership can be added, requested, updated and deleted. You can also get all members of a group, or all memberships for a given user.

role.description: The role of the user in the group.

created_at.description: The time this membership was created.

modified_at.description: The time this membership was last modified.

DevicePinner.title: Device Pinner Object
DevicePinner.description: Device pins allow enterprises to control what devices can use native Box applications. To learn more about device pinning, please see our  documentation.

owned_by.description: The user that the pin belongs to

product_name.description: The type of device being pinned

created_at.description: The time this pin was created

modified_at.description: The time this pin was modified

RetentionPolicyReference.description: Mini representation of the retention policy

policy_name.description: The name given to the retention policy

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention Policy Object
RetentionPolicy.description: A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention policies and then later assign them to specific folders or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must have the manage retention policies scope enabled for your API key via your application management console. For more information about retention policies, please visit our help documentation.

policy_type.description: The type of the retention policy. A retention policy type can either be finite, where a specific amount of time to retain the content is known upfront, or indefinite, where the amount of time to retain the content is still unknown.

retention_length.description: The length of the retention policy. This length specifies the duration in days that the retention policy will beactive for after being assigned to content.

disposition_action.description: The disposition action of the retention policy. This actioncan be permanently_delete, which will cause the content retained by the policy to be permanently deleted, or remove_retention, which will lift the retention policy from the content, allowing it to be deleted by users, once the retention policy time period has passed.

status.description: The status of a retention policy. The status of a policy will be active, unless explicitly retired by an administrator, in which case the status will be retired. Once a policyhas been retired, it cannot become active again.

created_by.description: A mini user object representing the user that created the retention policy.

created_at.description: The time that the retention policy was created.

modified_at.description: The time that the retention policy was last modified.

RetentionPolicyAssignment.title: Retention Policy Assignment Object
RetentionPolicyAssignment.description: The retention policy assignment endpoint provides a way for admins to apply a retention policy on a per-folder basis, or place a blanket policy over the entire enterprise.

retention_policy.description: A mini retention policy object representing the retention policy that has been assigned to this content.

assigned_to.description: The type and id of the content that is under retention. The type can either be folder or enterprise.

assigned_by.description: A mini user object representing the user that created the retention policy assignment.

assigned_at.description: The time that the retention policy assignment was created.

FileVersionRetention.title: File Version Retention Object
FileVersionRetention.description: A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content for a specified amount of time. Admins can apply policies to specified folders, or an entire enterprise. A file version retention is a record for a retained file version. To use this feature, you must have the manage retention policies scope enabled for your API key via your application management console. For more information about retention policies, please visit our help documentation.

file_version.description: The file version this file version retention was applied to.

file.description: The file this file version retention was applied to.

applied_at.description: The time that this file version retention was created.

disposition_at.description: The time that the retention period expires on this file version retention.

winning_retention_policy.description: The winning retention policy applied to this file_version_retention. A file version can have multiple retention policies applied.

AssignmentCounts.description: Counts of assignments within this policy by apply-to type.

LegalHoldPolicy.title: Legal Hold Policy object
LegalHoldPolicy.description: Legal Hold Policy information describes the basic characteristics of the Policy, such as name, description, and filter dates.

policy_name.description: Name of the Policy. This is limited to 254 characters.

description.description: The type and id of the content that is under retention. The type can either be folder or enterprise.

modified_at.description: Time that the Policy itself was modified. Does not update when assignments are added or removed.

deleted_at.description: Time that the policy release request was sent.

filter_started_at.description: User-specified, optional date filter applies to Custodian assignments only.

filter_ended_at.description: User-specified, optional date filter applies to Custodian assignments only.

release_notes.description: Notes around why the policy was released. Optional property with a 500 character limit.

LegalHoldPolicyAssignment.title: Legal Hold Policy Assignment object
LegalHoldPolicyAssignment.description: Legal Hold Assignments are used to assign Legal Hold Policies to Custodians, Folders, Files, or File Versions. Creating a Legal Hold Assignment puts a hold on the File-Versions that belong to the Assignment's 'apply-to' entity.

legal_hold_policy.description: The Policy that this Assignment is part of.

assigned_to.description: The entity that this is assigned to. Includes type and ID.

deleted_at.description: Time that the Assignment release request was sent.

FileVersionLegalHold.title: File Version Legal Hold object
FileVersionLegalHold.description: File-Version-Legal-Hold is an entity representing all holds on a File Version. Type is legal-hold.

file.description: The parent file of the File-Version that is held. Note that there is no guarantee that the current version of this File is held.

legal_hold_policy_assignments.description: List of assignments contributing to this Hold.

deleted_at.description: Time that this File-Version-Legal-Hold was deleted.

data.description: The data for the operation.  Can vary depending on the operation.

fieldKey.description: For operations that affect a specific field, the key of the field to be affected.

fieldKeys.description: For operations that affect multiple fields, the keys of the fields to be affected.

enumOptionKeys.description: For operations that affect multiple enum options, the keys of the enum options to be affected.

op.description: The operation type. Must be add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy.

path.description: The path that designates the key, in the format of a JSON-Pointer. Since all keys are located at the root of the metadata instance, the key must be prefixed with a /. Special characters ~ and / in the key must be escaped according to JSON-Pointer specification. The value at the path must exist for the operation to be successful.

value.description: The value to be set or tested. Required for add, replace, and test operations. For add, if value already exists, then previous value will be overwritten by the new value. For replace, the metadata value must exist before replacing.For test, the value of the existing metadata instance must match the specified value.

from.description: Required for move or copy. The path that designates the source key, in the format of a JSON-Pointer, formatted in the same way as path. Used in conjunction with path: from specifies the source, path specifies the destination.

CreateLegalHoldPolicyAssignment.description: Request object to create a new Legal Policy Hold Assignment

policy_id.description: ID of Policy to create Assignment for.

assign_to.description: Target Object. Type of target and ID of the target entity

CreateRetentionPolicyAssignment.description: Request object to create a new Retention Policy Assignment

policy_id.description: ID of Policy to create Assignment for.

assign_to.description: Target Object. Type of target and ID of the target entity

options.description: The Pre-flight check API will verify that a file will be accepted by Box before you send all the bytes over the wire.

200.description: The upload would be successful

get.summary: Get File's Info, Get Embed Link
get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata about a file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

200.description: A full file object is returned if the ID is valid and if the user has access to the file.

404.description: File Not Found

put.summary: Update File Info, Lock and Unlock, Create Shared Link

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The etag of the file can be included as an ‘If-Match’ header to prevent race conditions.

200.description: A full file object is returned if the ID is valid and if the user has access to the file.

delete.description: Discards a file to the trash. The etag of the file can be included as an ‘If-Match’ header to prevent race conditions.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The etag of the file. This is in the ‘etag’ field of the file object.

204.description: An empty 204 response is sent to confirm deletion of the file.

412.description: If the If-Match header is sent and fails, a 412 Precondition Failed error is returned.

post.description: Restores an item that has been moved to the trash. Default behavior is to restore the item to the folder it was in before it was moved to the trash. If that parent folder no longer exists or if there is now an item with the same name in that parent folder, the new parent folder and/or new name will need to be included in the request.

201.description: The full item will be returned with a 201 Created status. By default it is restored to the parent folder it was in before it was trashed.

403.description: The user doesn’t have access to the folder the item is being restored to or the user doesn’t have permission to restore items from the trash

404.description: The item is not in the trash

409.description: There is an item with the same name in the folder the item is being restored to

get.description: Retrieves the actual data of the file. An optional version parameter can be set to download a previous version of the file.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: The range value in bytes. Format should be bytes={start_range}-{end_range}

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The ID specific version of this file to download.

parameters.name: BoxApi
parameters.description: The shared link for this item. Format should be shared_link=SHARED_LINK

202.description: If the file is not ready to be downloaded (i.e. in the case where the file was uploaded immediately before the download request), a response with an HTTP status of 202 Accepted will be returned with a Retry-After header indicating the time in seconds after which the file will be available for the client to download.

302.description: If the file is available to be downloaded, the response will be a 302 Found to a URL at dl.boxcloud.com. The dl.boxcloud.com URL is not persistent. Clients will need to follow the redirect in order to actually download the file. The raw data of the file is returned unless the file ID is invalid or the user does not have access to it.

get.description: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to retrieve information about the older versions. (Versions are only tracked for Box users with premium accounts.)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: An array of version objects are returned. If there are no previous versions of this file, then an empty array will be returned.

post.description: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to promote one of the older versions to the top of the stack. This actually mints a copy of the old version and puts it on the top of the versions stack. The file will have the exact same contents, the same SHA1/etag, and the same name as the original. Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their former values.

201.description: The newly promoted file_version object is returned, along with a ‘201 Created’ status.

delete.description: Discards a specific file version to the trash. (Depending on the enterprise settings for this user, the item will either be actually deleted from Box or moved to the trash.)

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The etag of the file. This is in the ‘etag’ field of the file object.

204.description: An empty 204 response is sent to confirm deletion of the file.

412.description: If the If-Match header is sent and fails, a ‘412 Precondition Failed’ error is returned.

post.description: Used to create a copy of a file in another folder. The original version of the file will not be altered.

201.description: A full file object is returned if the ID is valid and if the update is successful.

409.description: A 409 will be returned if the intended destination folder is the same, as this will cause a name collision.

get.description: Retrieves a thumbnail, or smaller image representation, of this file. Sizes of 32x32,64x64, 128x128, and 256x256 can be returned in the .png format and sizes of 32x32, 94x94, 160x160, and 320x320 can be returned in the .jpg format. Thumbnails can be generated for the image and video file formats listed here.

parameters.name: EXTENSION
parameters.description: The preview format, e.g. png or jpg

parameters.name: min_height
parameters.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail

200.description: If the thumbnail is available, a 200 OK response will be returned with the contents of the thumbnail in the body.

202.description: If the thumbnail isn’t available yet, a 202 Accepted HTTP status will be returned, including a Location header pointing to a placeholder graphic that can be used until the thumbnail is returned.

Retry-After.description: The time in seconds after which the thumbnail will be available. Your application should only attempt to get the thumbnail again after Retry-After time.

Location.description: Pointing to a placeholder graphic that can be used until the thumbnail is returned.

302.description: If Box can’t generate a thumbnail for this file type, a 302 Found response will be returned, redirecting to a placeholder graphic in the requested size for this particular file type, e.g. this for a CSV file).

400.description: If there are any bad parameters sent in, a standard 400 Bad Request will be returned.

404.description: If Box is unable to generate a thumbnail for this particular file, a 404 Not Found response will be returned with a code of preview_cannot_be_generated.

get.description: Retrieves an item that has been moved to the trash.

200.description: The full item will be returned, including information about when the it was moved to the trash.

404.description: A 404 will be returned if the item is not in the trash.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an item that is in the trash. The item will no longer exist in Box. This action cannot be undone.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response will be returned upon successful deletion.

404.description: A 404 will be returned if the item is not in the trash.

get.description: Retrieves the comments on a particular file, if any exist.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A collection of comment objects are returned. If there are no comments on the file, an empty comments array is returned.

get.description: Use this to get a list of all the collaborations on a file

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

200.description: A collection of collaboration objects is returned

get.description: Retrieves all of the tasks for given file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A collection of mini task objects is returned. If there are no tasks, an empty collection will be returned.

post.description: Used to create a new empty folder. The new folder will be created inside of the specified parent folder

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: A full folder object is returned if the parent folder ID is valid and if no name collisions occur.

get.description: Retrieves the full metadata about a folder, including information about when it was last updated as well as the files and folders contained in it. The root folder of a Box account is always represented by the id “0”.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A full folder object is returned, including the most current information available about it.

401.description: 4xx if the user does not have access to it.

404.description: An 404 error is thrown if the folder does not exist.

put.summary: Update Folder, Create Shared Link, Create or Delete
put.description:
Used to update information about the folder. To move a folder, update the ID of its parent. To enable an email address that can be used to upload files to this folder, update the folder_upload_email attribute. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only updates the folder if it knows about the latest version.

Used to create a shared link for this particular folder. Please see here for more information on the permissions available for shared links. In order to get default shared link status, set it to an empty access level, i.e. {"shared_link": {}}. In order to disable a shared link, send this same type of PUT request with the value of shared_link set to null, i.e. {"shared_link": null}

To add or remove an item from a collection, you do a PUT on that item and change the list of collections it belongs to. Philosophically, this is similar to the way “move” operations work on files and folders: you do a PUT on the item and change its parent. It’s the same idea with collections, except you’re changing which collection(s) the item belongs to instead of the folder it belongs to. Currently the only collection available is the favorites collection, and you’ll need to know it’s ID for the user that is making the API call, since every user has a different favorites collection_id.
The Add/Remove API handling will check all ids passed in before performing any add/removal operations. If any collection ids are malformed or do not exist in the user’s account, the API call will throw a 400. Only if all of the collection ids are valid will the adds and removals be carried out.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: This is in the ‘etag’ field of the folder object.

200.description: The updated folder

201.description: When 'collections' is specified in body the folder is moved into collection with the ID

delete.description: Used to delete a folder. A recursive parameter must be included in order to delete folders that have items inside of them. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only deletes the folder if it knows about the latest version.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: This is in the ‘etag’ field of the folder object.

204.description: An empty 204 response will be returned upon successful deletion.

400.description: An error is thrown if the folder is not empty and the ‘recursive’ parameter is not included.

post.description: Restores an item that has been moved to the trash. Default behavior is to restore the item to the folder it was in before it was moved to the trash. If that parent folder no longer exists or if there is now an item with the same name in that parent folder, the new parent folder and/or new name will need to be included in the request.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: The full item will be returned with a 201 Created status. By default it is restored to the parent folder it was in before it was trashed.

403.description: The user doesn’t have access to the folder the item is being restored to or the user doesn’t have permission to restore items from the trash

405.description: The item is not in the trash

409.description: There is an item with the same name in the folder the item is being restored to

get.description: Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this folder without any other metadata about the folder. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in separated by commas e.g. fields=name,created_at. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Note: If there are hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be = offset + limit, not the # of records you received back. The default is 0.

200.description: A collection of items contained in the folder is returned.

post.description: Used to create a copy of a folder in another folder. The original version of the folder will not be altered.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: A full folder object is returned if the ID is valid and if the update is successful.

409.description: If the intended destination folder is the same, as this will cause a name collision.

get.description: Use this to get a list of all the collaborations on a folder i.e. all of the users that have access to that folder.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

200.description: A collection of collaboration objects are returned. If there are no collaborations on this folder, an empty collection will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves an folder that has been moved to the trash.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The full folder will be returned, including information about when the it was moved to the trash.

404.description: If the folder is not in the trash.

delete.description: Permanently deletes an folder that is in the trash. The item will no longer exist in Box. This action cannot be undone.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response will be returned upon successful deletion.

404.description: If the folder is not in the trash.

default.description: Permanently delete a folder operation error

get.description: Retrieves the files and/or folders that have been moved to the trash. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in separated by commas e.g. fields=name,created_at. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

200.description: A collection of items contained in the trash is returned

get.description: Used to retrieve the watermark for a corresponding Box file.

200.description: An object containing information about the watermark associated for this file.

404.description: An 404 error is thrown if the the file does not have the watermark.

put.description: Used to apply or update the watermark for a corresponding Box file. The endpoint accepts a JSON body describing the watermark to apply.

200.description: An object containing information about the watermark associated for this file.

201.description: If the file did not previously have a watermark applied to it, 201 Created is returned.

delete.description: Used to remove the watermark for a corresponding Box file.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response to confirm the watermark has been removed.

404.description: If the file did not have a watermark applied to it, a 404 Not Found will be returned.

get.description: Used to retrieve the watermark for a corresponding Box folder.

200.description: An object containing information about the watermark associated for this folder.

404.description: If the folder does not have a watermark applied to it, a 404 Not Found will be returned.

put.description: Used to apply or update the watermark for a corresponding Box folder. The endpoints accepts a JSON body describing the watermark to apply.

200.description: An object containing information about the watermark associated for this folder.

201.description: If the folder did not previously have a watermark applied to it, 201 Created is returned.

delete.description: Used to remove the watermark for a corresponding Box Folder.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response to confirm the watermark has been removed.

404.description: If the folder did not have a watermark applied to it, a 404 Not Found will be returned.

post.description: Creates a web link object within a given folder.

200.description: Created Web link object

get.description: Use to get information about the web link.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The web link object is returned.

put.description: Updates information for a web link.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: An updated web link object if the update was successful.

delete.description: Deletes a web link and moves it to the trash

204.description: An empty 204 response if successfully deleted and moved to trash.

post.description: Used to create a new metadata template with the specified schema.

201.description: The schema representing the metadata template created.

400.description: Request body contains invalid metadata schema.

403.description: Request body contains a scope that the user is not allowed to create a template for.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata templates within a user's enterprise. Currently only the enterprise scope is supported.

200.description: All the templates within an enterprise and their corresponding schema

fields.description: What stage in the process the document is in
Next document stage after approval is given

fields.displayName: Maximum Days Allowed In Current Stage
fields.description: Maximum number of days that the document is allowed to be in this stage.

get.description: Used to retrieve the schema for a given metadata template.

200.description: The schema representing the metadata template queried

put.description: Used to update the schema of an existing template.

200.description: The schema representing the updated metadata template.

400.description: Request body contains invalid metadata schema.

403.description: Request body contains a scope that the user is not allowed to create templates for.

404.description: Requested template is not found.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata associated with a given file

200.description: An array of metadata instances associated with the file.

post.description: Used to create the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box file. When creating metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

200.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

409.description: If the template instance already exists, a 409 HTTP status code of conflict will be returned and the update method should be used.

get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box file.

201.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

404.description: If there is no template instance present, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found will be returned.

put.description:
Used to update the template instance. The request body must follow the JSON-Patch specification, which is represented as a JSON array of operation objects (see examples for more details). Updates can be either add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.
The update is applied atomically. If any errors occur during the application of the update operations, the metadata instance remains unchanged.

200.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

404.description: If there is no template instance present, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found will be returned.

delete.description: Used to delete the template instance. To delete custom key:value pairs within a template instance, you should refer to the updating metadata section.

204.description: An empty HTTP 204 response to confirm the deletion of the template instance.

get.description: Used to retrieve all metadata associated with a given folder

200.description: An array of metadata instances associated with the folder.

post.description: Used to create the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box folder. When creating metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

200.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

409.description: If the template instance already exists, a 409 HTTP status code of conflict will be returned and the update method should be used.

get.description: Used to retrieve the metadata template instance for a corresponding Box folder.

201.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

404.description: If there is no template instance present, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found will be returned.

put.description: Used to update the template instance. Updates can be either add, replace, remove , or test. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted.

200.description: An instance of the template that includes key:value pairs defined by a user or application.

404.description: If there is no template instance present, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found will be returned

delete.description: Used to delete the template instance. To delete custom key:value pairs within a template instance, you should refer to the updating metadata section.

204.description: An empty HTTP 204 response to confirm the deletion of the template instance.

get.description: Used to retrieve all pending collaboration invites for this user.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Must be 'pending'

200.description: A collection of pending collaboration objects are returned. If the user has no pending collaborations, the collection will be empty.

post.description: Used to add a collaboration for a single user or a single group to a folder. Either an email address, a user ID, or a group id can be used to create the collaboration. If the collaboration is being created with a group, access to this endpoint is granted based on the group's invitability_level.

201.description: The new collaboration object is returned. Errors may occur if the IDs are invalid or if the user does not have permissions to create a collaboration.

get.description: Used to get information about a single collaboration. All collaborations for a single folder can be retrieved through GET /folders/{id}/collaborations. A complete list of the user’s pending collaborations can also be retrieved.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Can only be pending

200.description: The collaboration object is returned. Errors may occur if the IDs are invalid or if the user does not have permissions to see the collaboration.

put.description: Used to edit an existing collaboration. Descriptions of the various roles can be found here.

200.description: The updated collaboration object is returned.

204.description: If the role is changed to owner, the collaboration is deleted with a new one created for the previous owner.

delete.description: Used to delete a single collaboration.

204.description: A blank 204 response is returned if the ID is valid, and the user has permissions to remove the collaboration.

get.description: The search endpoint provides a powerful way of finding items that are accessible by a single user or an entire enterprise. Leverage the parameters listed below to generate targeted advanced searches.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The string to search for; can be matched against item names, descriptions, text content of a file, and other fields of the different item types.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope for which you want to limit your search to. Can be user_content for a search limited to only the current user or enterprise_content for the entire enterprise. To enable the enterprise_content scope for an administrator, please contact us.

parameters.name: file_extensions
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific file extensions like pdf,png,doc. Requires one or a set of comma delimited file extensions: file_extension_1,file_extension_2,....

parameters.name: created_at_range
parameters.description: The date for when the item was created. Specify the date range by using RFC3339 timestamp variables separated by a comma: from_date,to_date (e.g 2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00). Trailing from_date, and leading ,to_date commas are also accepted, where the current date and earliest known date will be designated respectively.

parameters.name: updated_at_range
parameters.description: The date for when the item was last updated. Specify the date range by using RFC3339 variables separated by a comma: from_date,to_date(e.g 2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00). Trailing from_date, and leading ,to_date commas are also accepted, where the current date and earliest known date will be designated respectively.

parameters.name: size_range
parameters.description: Filter by a file size range. Specify the file size range in bytes separated by a comma:lower_bound_size,upper_bound_size, where 1MB is equivalent to 1000000 bytes. Trailing lower_bound_size, and leading ,upper_bound_size commas are also accepted as parameters.

parameters.name: owner_user_ids
parameters.description: Search by item owners. Requires one or a set of comma delimited user_ids: user_id_1,user_id_2,...

parameters.name: ancestor_folder_ids
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific parent folders. Requires one or a set of comma delimited folder_ids: folder_id_1,folder_id_2,.... Parent folder results will also include items within subfolders.

parameters.name: content_types
parameters.description: Limit searches to specific Box designated content types. Can be name, description, file_content, comments, or tags. Requires one or a set of comma delimited content_types: content_type_1,content_type_2,....

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type you want to return in your search. Can be file, folder, or web_link.

parameters.name: trash_content
parameters.description: Allows you to search within the trash. Can be trashed_only or non_trashed_only. Searches without this parameter default to non_trashed_only.

parameters.name: mdfilters
parameters.description: Filters for a specific metadata template for files with metadata object associations. The filters are to be placed in a single JSON object. Please refer the MDFilters object in the definitions section of the swagger.json

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of search results to return. The default is 30 and the max is 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The search result at which to start the response. The default is 0.

200.description: A collection of search results is returned. If there are no matching search results, the entries array will be empty.

get.description:
Shared items are any files or folders that are represented by a shared link. Shared items are different from other API resources in that a shared resource doesn’t necessarily have to be in the account of the user accessing it. The actual shared link itself is used along with a normal access token.
Used to retrieve the metadata about a shared item when only given a shared link. Because of varying permission for shared links, a password may be required to retrieve the shared item. Once the item has been retrieved, you can make API requests against the actual resource /files/{id} or /folders/{id} as long as the shared link and optional password are in the header.

parameters.name: BoxApi
parameters.description: The usage is 'BoxApi: shared_link=SHARED_LINK&shared_link_password=SHARED_LINK_PASSWORD'

200.description: A full file or folder object is returned if the shared link is valid and the user has access to it.

get.description: Retrieves the collections for the given user. Currently, only the favorites collection is supported.

200.description: Collections for the given user

get.description:
Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this collection. Collection item lists behave a lot like getting a folder’s items.
Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.
Sub-object fields can be requested via the ?fields parameter

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Offset of 2 would start at the 2nd record, not the second page. Note: If there are hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be = offset + limit, not the # of records you received back.

200.description: An array of items contained in the collection is returned.

default.description: An error is thrown if the collection does not exist, or if any of the parameters are invalid.

post.description: Used to add a comment by the user to a specific file or comment (i.e. as a reply comment).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

201.description: The new comment object is returned. Errors may occur if the item id is invalid, the item type is invalid/unsupported, you don’t include either a message or a tagged_message, or if the user does not have access to the item being commented on.

default.description: Errors may occur if the item id is invalid, the item type is invalid/unsupported, you don’t include either a message or a tagged_message, or if the user does not have access to the item being commented on.

get.description: Used to retrieve the message and metadata about a specific comment. Information about the user who created the comment is also included.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

200.description: A full comment object is returned is the ID is valid and if the user has access to the comment.

put.description: Used to update the message of the comment.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response.

200.description: The full updated comment object is returned if the ID is valid and if the user has access to the comment.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a comment.

204.description: An empty 204 response is returned to confirm deletion of the comment. Errors can be thrown if the ID is invalid or if the user is not authorized to delete this particular comment.

default.description: Errors can be thrown if the ID is invalid or if the user is not authorized to delete this particular comment.

post.description: Used to create a single task for single user on a single file.

201.description: A new task object will be returned upon success.

get.description: Fetches a specific task.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The specified task object will be returned upon success.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The updated task object will be returned upon success.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a specific task.

204.description: An empty 204 response will be returned upon success.

get.description: Retrieves all of the assignments for a given task.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A collection of task assignment mini objects will be returned upon success.

post.description: Used to assign a task to a single user. There can be multiple assignments on a given task.

201.description: A new task assignment object will be returned upon success.

get.description: Fetches a specific task assignment.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The specified task assignment object will be returned upon success.

put.description: Used to update a task assignment.

200.description: A new task assignment object will be returned upon success.

delete.description: Deletes a specific task assignment.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response will be returned upon success.

get.description:
Use this to get events for a given user. A chunk of event objects is returned for the user based on the parameters passed in. Parameters indicating how many chunks are left as well as the next stream_position are also returned.

To retrieve Enterprise Events specify 'stream_type=admin_logs'. Retrieves up to a year' events for all users in an enterprise. Upper and lower bounds as well as filters can be applied to the results.

parameters.name: stream_position
parameters.description: The location in the event stream at which you want to start receiving events. Can specify special case ‘now’ to get 0 events and the latest stream position for initialization.

parameters.name: stream_type
parameters.description: Limits the type of events returned: all: returns everything, changes: returns tree changes, sync: returns tree changes only for sync folders

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of events returned

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of events to filter by

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: A lower bound on the timestamp of the events returned

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: An upper bound on the timestamp of the events returned

200.description: A collection of events is returned. See the above table for descriptions of the event types.

options.description:
To get real-time notification of activity in a Box account, use the long poll feature of the /events API. To do so, first call the /events API with an OPTIONS call to retrieve the long poll URL to use. Next, make a GET request to the provided URL to begin listening for events. If an event occurs within an account you are monitoring, you will receive a response with the value new_change. It’s important to note that this response will not come with any other details, but should serve as a prompt to take further action such as calling the /events endpoint with your last known stream_position. After sending this response, the server will close the connection and you will need to repeat the long poll process to begin listening for events again.
If no events occur for a period of time after you make the GET request to the long poll URL, you will receive a response with the value reconnect. When you receive this response, you’ll make another OPTIONS call to the /events endpoint and repeat the long poll process.
If you receive no events in retry_timeout seconds, you should make another GET request to the real time server (i.e. URL in the response). This might be necessary in case you do not receive the reconnect message in the face of network errors.
If you receive max_retries error when making GET requests to the real time server, you should make another OPTIONS request.

200.description: Paginated array of Realtime server instances

post.description: Used to provision a new user in an enterprise. This method only works for enterprise admins.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: Returns the full user object for the newly created user. Errors may be thrown when the fields are invalid or this API call is made from a non-admin account.

get.description: Returns a list of all users for the Enterprise along with their user_id, public_name, and login.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: filter_term
parameters.description: A string used to filter the results to only users starting with the filter_term in either the name or the login.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The record at which to start. The default is 0.

parameters.name: user_type
parameters.description: The type of user to search for. Valid values are all, external or managed.  If nothing is provided, the default behavior will be managed only

get.description: Retrieves information about the user who is currently logged in i.e. the user for whom this auth token was generated.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: Returns a single complete user object.

get.description: Retrieves information about a user in the enterprise. Requires enterprise administration authorization.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: Returns a single complete user object. Note: The GET /users{id} endpoint also returns a limited set of information for external users who are collaborated on content owned by the enterprise for certain admin scopes/users. Disallowed fields will return null.

put.description:
Used to edit the settings and information about a user. This method only works for enterprise admins. To roll a user out of the enterprise (and convert them to a standalone free user), update the special enterprise attribute to be null.

Used to convert one of the user’s confirmed email aliases into the user’s primary login.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: Returns the a full user object for the updated user. Errors may be thrown when the fields are invalid or this API call is made from a non-admin account.

default.description: Errors may be thrown when the fields are invalid or this API call is made from a non-admin account.

delete.description: Deletes a user in an enterprise account.

204.description: An empty 204 response is sent to confirm deletion of the user. If the user still has files in their account and the ‘force’ parameter is not sent, an error is returned.

default.description: If the user still has files in their account and the ‘force’ parameter is not sent, an error is returned.

put.description: Moves all of the owned content from within one user’s folder into a new folder in another user’s account. You can move folders across users as long as the you have administrative permissions and the ‘source’ user owns the folders. To move everything from the root folder, use “0” which always represents the root folder of a Box account.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: Returns the information for the newly created destination folder.. An error is thrown if you do not have the necessary permissions to move the folder.

default.description: An error is thrown if you do not have the necessary permissions to move the folder.

get.description: Retrieves all email aliases for this user. The collection of email aliases does not include the primary login for the user; use GET /users/USER_ID to retrieve the login email address.

200.description: If the user_id is valid a collection of email aliases will be returned.

post.description: Adds a new email alias to the given user’s account.

201.description: Returns the newly created email_alias object.

default.description: Errors will be thrown if the user_id is not valid or the particular user’s email alias cannot be modified.

delete.description: Removes an email alias from a user.

204.description: If the user has permission to remove this email alias, an empty 204 No Content response will be returned to confirm deletion.

post.description: Invites an existing user to join an Enterprise. The existing user can not be part of another Enterprise and must already have a Box account. Once invited, the user will receive an email and prompt to accept the invitation within the Box web application. This method requires the "Manage An Enterprise" scope for the enterprise, which can be enabled within your developer console.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A new invite object will be returned if successful. The status of the invite can also be queried by retrieving the invite object. This can be done by making a GET request to /invites/{invite_id}.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: Status of the invite is returned

post.description: Used to create a group.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: A new group object will be returned upon success.

get.description: Retrieves all of the groups for given enterprise. Must have permissions to see an enterprise's groups.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response.

200.description: A collection of mini group objects is returned. If there are no groups, an empty collection will be returned.

get.description: Used to get information about a group.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A group object that was requested.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The updated group object will be returned upon success.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a specific group.

204.description: An empty 204 response will be returned upon success.

post.description: Used to add a member to a Group.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

201.description: A new group membership object will be returned upon success.

get.description: Fetches a specific group membership entry.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: The specified group_membership object will be returned upon success.

put.description: Used to update a group membership.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

200.description: A new group membership object will be returned upon success.

delete.description: Deletes a specific group membership.

204.description: An empty 204 No Content response will be returned upon success.

get.description: Retrieves all of the members for a given group if the requesting user has access (see Group Object member_viewability_level).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response.

200.description: A collection of group membership objects will be returned upon success.

get.description: Retrieves all of the group memberships for a given user. Note this is only available to group admins. To retrieve group memberships for the user making the API request, use the users/me/memberships endpoint.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default is 100. Max is 1000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response

get.description: Retrieves all of the group collaborations for a given group. Note this is only available to group admins.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Attribute(s) to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The item at which to begin the response.

200.description: A collection of collaboration objects will be returned upon success.

accessible_by.name: Hand of the King inner counsel

get.description: Gets all the device pins within a given enterprise. Must be an enterprise admin with the manage enterprise scope to make this call.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Needs not be passed or can be empty for first invocation of the API. Use the one returned in response for each subsequent call.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default value is 100. Max value is 10000

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Default is "asc". Valid values are asc, desc. Case in-sensitive, ASC/DESC works just fine.

200.description: Returns a list of device pins for a given enterprise.

default.description: Get device pinners for an enterprise error

get.description: Gets information about an individual device pin.

200.description: Returns information about a single device pin.

delete.description: Delete individual device pin.

204.description: A 204 will be returned if deletion is successful

post.description: Used to create a new retention policy.

201.description: A new retention policy object will be returned upon success.

400.description: If a “retention_length” or incorrect “disposition_action” is specified for an indefinite policy, a 400 HTTP status code of bad_request will be returned.

409.description: If a retention policy with the given name already exists, a 409 HTTP status code of conflict will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves all of the retention policies for the given enterprise.

parameters.name: policy_name
parameters.description: A name to filter the retention policies by. A trailing partial match search is performed.

parameters.name: policy_type
parameters.description: A policy type to filter the retention policies by.

parameters.name: created_by_user_id
parameters.description: A user id to filter the retention policies by.

200.description: Returns the list of all retention policies for the enterprise. If query parameters are given, only the retention policies that match the query parameters are returned.

400.description: If a bad “policy_type” is given, a 400 HTTP status code of bad_request is returned.

404.description: If the user specified in the “created_by_user_id” does not exist, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found is returned.

get.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy

200.description: The specified retention policy will be returned upon success.

404.description: If the retention policy specified does not exist, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found is returned.

put.description: Used to update a retention policy.

200.description: An updated retention policy object will be returned upon success.

400.description: If an incorrect “disposition_action” is specified for an indefinite policy, a 400 HTTP status code of bad_request will be returned.

409.description: If a retention policy with the given name already exists, a 409 HTTP status code of conflict will be returned.

get.description: Returns a list of all retention policy assignments associated with a specified retention policy.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the retention policy assignment to retrieve. Can either be folder or enterprise.

200.description: Returns a list of the retention policy assignments associated with the specified retention policy.

400.description: If a bad “type” parameter is given, a 400 HTTP status code of bad_request is returned.

post.description: Returns a list of all retention policy assignments associated with a specified retention policy.

201.description: A new retention policy assignment will be returned upon success.

400.description: If an “id” is specified while assigning a retention policy to an enterprise, a 400 HTTP status code of bad_request is returned.

404.description: If no retention policy with the given “policy_id” exists, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found is returned.

409.description: If a retention policy of equal or greater length has already been assigned to this content, a 409 HTTP status_code of conflict is returned.

get.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy assignment.

200.description: The specified retention policy assignment will be returned upon success.

404.description: If no retention policy assignment with the given ID exists, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found is returned.

get.description: Retrieves all file version retentions for the given enterprise.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: A file id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: file_version_id
