parameters.description: A file version id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: policy_id
parameters.description: A policy id to filter the file version retentions by.

parameters.name: disposition_action
parameters.description: The disposition action of the retention policy. This action can be permanently_delete, which will cause the content retained by the policy to be permanently deleted, or remove_retention, which will lift the retention policy from the content, allowing it to be deleted by users, once the retention policy time period has passed.

parameters.name: disposition_before
parameters.description: See content times for formatting

parameters.name: disposition_after
parameters.description: See content times for formatting

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Base 64 encoded string that represents where the paging should being. It should be left blank to begin paging.

200.description: Returns the list of all file version retentions for the enterprise. If the query parameters are given, only the file version retentions that match the query parameters are returned.

get.description: Used to retrieve information about a file version retention

200.description: The specified file version retention will be returned upon success.

404.description: If the file version retention specified does not exist, a 404 HTTP status code of not_found is returned.

post.description: Create a new Legal Hold Policy. Optional date filter may be passed. If Policy has a date filter, any Custodian assignments will apply only to file versions created or uploaded inside of the date range.

201.description: A new retention policy object will be returned upon success.

409.description: If the Policy Name is in use for your enterprise, will return a 409.

get.description: Get a list of Legal Hold Policies that belong to your Enterprise.

parameters.name: policy_name
parameters.description: Case insensitive prefix-match filter on Policy name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit result size to this number. Defaults to 100, maximum is 1,000.

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: Take from next_marker column of a prior call to get the next page

200.description: Returns the list of Legal Hold Policies in your Enterprise that match the filter parameters. By default, will only return only 'type', 'id', and 'policy_name', but you can specify more by using the 'fields' parameter.

put.description: Update existing Legal Hold Policy. Only name and description can be modified.

201.description: Returns information about the Legal Hold Policy updated.

get.description: Get details of a single Legal Hold Policy

200.description: If the ID is valid, information about the Legal Hold Policy is returned with a 200

404.description: If the ID is for a non-existent Legal Hold Policy, a 404 is returned.

delete.description: Sends request to delete an existing Legal Hold Policy. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the Policy will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

202.description: Returns a 202 if the request to delete the Policy was accepted.

get.description: Get list of assignments for a single Policy.

200.description: Returns the list of Assignments for the passed in Policy, as well as any optional filter parameters passed in. By default, will only return only type, and id, but you can specify more by using the fields parameter.

default.description: Get Legal Hold policy assignments error

post.summary: Create New Legal Hold Policy Assignment
post.description: Create a new Assignment, which will apply the Legal Hold Policy to the target of the Assignment.

201.description: For a successful request, returns a 200 with information about the Assignment created.

404.description: If the policy or assign-to target cannot be found, a 404 will be returned.

default.description: Create Legal hold policy assignment error

get.description: Get details of a single assignment.

200.description: If the ID is valid, information about the Assignment is returned with a 200.

404.description: If the ID is for a non-existent Assignment, a 404 is returned.

default.description: Delete Legal Hold policy Assignment error

delete.description: Sends request to delete an existing Assignment. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the Assignment will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

204.description: A successful request returns 204 No Content.

409.description: If the Assignment is still initializing, will return a 409.

get.summary: Get List of File Version Legal Holds
get.description: Get list of non-deleted Holds for a single Policy.

200.description: Returns the list of File Version Legal Holds for the passed in Policy. By default, will only return only type, and id, but you can specify more by using the fields parameter.

default.description: Get File Version Legal Hold policy error

get.description: Get details of a single File Version Legal Hold.

200.description: If the ID is valid, information about the Hold is returned with a 200.

404.description: If the ID is for a non-existent Hold, a 404 is returned.

default.description: Get File Version Legal Hold policy error

post.description: Create Webhook

201.description: Returns a webhook object if creation succeeds

404.description: Target could not be found

get.description:
Returns all defined webhooks for the requesting application and user, up to the limit. If no limit is supplied then Box uses the default limit of 100.
If more than limit webhooks are defined then Box returns the webhooks in batches. When the results are batched, Box sends limit webhooks along with a next_marker field in the response object. The value of the next_marker field is a marker string that you can use in later requests to tell Box which batch to send next.
When you send a request that includes a marker string, Box sends the next batch of webhooks, beginning after the last webhook of the previous batch. When the response contains the last of the defined webhooks, Box omits the next_marker field from its response.
You can use limit and marker together with the marker string returned in the next_marker field to paginate lists of webhooks.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of webhooks to return per page

parameters.name: marker
parameters.description: A marker string returned by Box if the result contains less than the full number of webhooks that are defined

200.description: A collection of webhooks.

get.description: Get a Webhook

200.description: Returns a webhook object

404.description: Webhook ID not found

200.description: Returns the updated webhook object.

404.description: Webhook ID not found

delete.description: Permanently deletes a webhook

204.description: An empty 204 response is returned to confirm deletion of the webhook.

404.description: Webhook ID not found
